API

### .3Dtransform
1.  2D  3D 
    - translate() XY
      ```
      transform: translate(100px,200px);
      ```
    - rotate 
      ```
      transform: rotate(60deg);
      ```
    - scale () XY
      ```
      transform: scale(2,2);
      ```
    - skew () XY
      ```
      transform: skew(40deg,50deg);
      ```

2. transform-origin
      ```
      transform-origin: x-axis y-axis z-axis;
      ```

3. transform-style 3D 
      ```
      // preserve-3d3D
      // flat2D
      transform-style: flat|preserve-3d;
      ```

4. perspective: perspective-origin  3D 
      ```
      perspective: number|none;
      ``` 

5. backface-visibility:
      ```
      backface-visibility: visible|hidden;
      ```

### .CSS3transition
1. 
   ```
   transition: property duration timing-function delay;
   ```
   ```
   transition-timing-function: linear|ease|ease-in|ease-out|ease-in-out|cubic-bezier(n,n,n,n);
   ```
### .CSS3 animation@keyframes
1. 
   - animation
   - @keyframes
   - 
   ```
    animation: animation-name animation-duration animation-timing-function animation-fill-mode animation-delay animation-iteration-count	animation-direction animation-play-state;

    animation-name(keyframe): keyframename|none;

    animation-duration():animation-duration: time | 0;

    animation-timing-function(,): linear	| ease	| ease-in | ease-out	| ease-in-out	 | cubic-bezier(n,n,n,n);

    animation-fill-mode(): none|forwards|backwards|both|initial|inherit;

    animation-delay(): time;

    animation-iteration-count():n |infinite

    animation-direction(): normal|reverse|alternate|alternate-reverse|initial|inherit;
    
    animation-play-state():paused|running;
   ```
 
### .css
   - matrix3d(http://ds-overdesign.com/transform/matrix3d.html)
   - matrix(http://meyerweb.com/eric/tools/matrix)
   - tools(http://www.f2e.name/case/css3/tools.html)

width: 100%;
background: green;
}
.left{
left: -200px;
width: 200px;
margin-left: -100%;
background: yellowgreen;
}
.right{

width: 200px;

float: left;

``` 5. ``` /****css****/ .main,.left,.right{ float: left; min-height: 500px; } .main{ width:100%; background-color: red; } .left{ width: 200px; margin-left: -100%; background-color: yellow; } .right{ width: 200px; background-color: green; margin-left: -200px; } .content{ margin: 0 200px; }

background: yellow;

(Mixins)

    @mixin product-public-text {
  font: {
    size: 20px;
    weight: 600;
    family: PingFangSC;
  }
  color: rgba(72,72,72,1);
}
.product-header-title {
  @include product-public-text;
  padding: 10px;
}

  font-weight: 600;
}

.product-public-font(@color: red) {
  font-size: 20px;
  color: @color;

Post.title: bind
Post.content:
bind call apply bind() 


this.value = 20;

let obj = {
  value: 29,
  getValue:function () {
    return this.value;
  }
}

//  this  obj
obj.getValue()  // 29

// obj.getValue  this  window
let valFun = obj.getValue;
valFun(); // 20

//  bind  this  obj 
let boundGetValue = valFun.bind(obj);
boundGetValue(); // 29


/**
 * obj.getValue() 
 * obj.getValue()() 
 *  this  window
 */
this.value = 20;

let obj = {
  value: 29,
  getValue:function () {
    return function () {
      return this.value
    }.bind(this);
  }
}

obj.getValue()() // 20



// bind this  _this = this
this.value = 20;

let obj = {
  value: 29,
  getValue:function () {
    return function () {
      return this.value
    }.bind(this);
  }
}

obj.getValue()() // 29


//  this  bind (  apply call)
this.value = 20;

let obj = {
  value: 29,
  getValue:function () {
    let _this = this;
    return function () {
      return _this.value
    }
  }
}

obj.getValue()() // 29

AABB

JS 


/**
 * 
 * 
 */
function list() {
  return Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments);
}

// 
let listArr = list.bind(null, 28);

console.log(listArr()); // [28]

console.log(listArr(1, 2, 3)); // [28, 1, 2, 3]


/**
 *  bind  
 * bind  call apply 
 */

function bar () {
  console.log(this.value);
}

let foo = {
  value: 1
}

let foo1 = {
  value: 2
}

let func = bar.bind(foo).bind(foo1);
console.log(func()); // 1

bind

1bind

2

3 bind 

Function.prototype.newBind = function (context) {
  var _this = this;
  //  bind 
  var _args = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments, 1);
  // 
  return function () {
    // bind 
    var _bindArgs = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments);
    // 
    return self.apply(context, _args.concat(_bindArgs));
  }
}

bind JS new bind this this new

1 this

2 bind 

Function.prototype.newBind  = function (context) {

  // 
  if (typeof this != 'function') {
    throw new TypeError('Function.prototype.bind - what is trying to be bound is not callable');
  }

  var _this = this;

  // 
  var _args = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments, 1);

  //  prototype  prototype 
  var _fNOP = function () {};

  // bind 
  var _fBound = function () {
    var _bindArgs = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments);
    //  _fBound  new 
    return _this.apply(this instanceof _fBound ? this : context, args.concat(_bindArgs));
  }

  //  _fBound 
  _fNOP.prototype = this.prototype;
  _fBound.prototype = new _fNOP();

  return _fBound;
}

// [4, 2, 3, 4, 5]

callback undefined

true false

Function.prototype.newCall = function (context, ...args) {

  //  this  null
  let ec = typeof window === 'object' ? window : global;

  // 
  let fn = Symbol();
  context = context || ec;

  //  this
  context[fn] = this;

  // 
  let result = context[fn](...args);

  // 
  delete context[fn];

  return result;
}

// 
let obj = {
  value: 1
};
function bar(name, age) {
  console.log(name);
  console.log(age);
  console.log(this.value);
}

bar.newCall(obj, 'renbo', 27);

// 
var sum = function(args){
  return args.reduce(function(a,b){
      return a+b
  });
};
var result = sum([1,2,3,4,5]); // 15

// 
function add() {
  var _args = [].slice.call(arguments);
  var adder = function () {

      // _args
      var _adder = function() {
          [].push.apply(_args, [].slice.call(arguments));
          return _adder;
      };

      // 
      _adder.toString = function () {
          return _args.reduce(function (a, b) {
              return a + b;
          });
      }

      return _adder;
  }
  return adder.apply(null, [].slice.call(arguments));
}

var sum = add();
sum(1,2,3)(4);
sum(5);
sum() // 15

var addEvent = function(el, type, fn, capture) {
    if (window.addEventListener) {
      el.addEventListener(type, function(e) {
        fn.call(el, e);
      }, capture);
    } else if (window.attachEvent) {
      el.attachEvent("on" + type, function(e) {
        fn.call(el, e);
      });
    } 
 };

 // 
 var addEvent = (function(){
    if (window.addEventListener) {
      return function(el, type, fn, capture) {
        el.addEventListener(type, function(e) {
          fn.call(el, e);
        }, (capture));
      };
    } else if (window.attachEvent) {
      return function(el, type, fn, capture) {
        el.attachEvent("on" + type, function(e) {
            fn.call(el, e);
        });
      };
    }
})();

``` // nesting-composition.js hosted with by GitHub const toSlug = input => encodeURIComponent( join('-')( map(toLowerCase)( split(' ')( input ) ) ) ); console.log(toSlug('JS Cheerleader')); // 'js-cheerleader' ``` `split``join``map`
``` // composables.js hosted with by GitHub const curry = fn => (...args) => fn.bind(null, ...args); const map = curry((fn, arr) => arr.map(fn)); const join = curry((str, arr) => arr.join(str)); const toLowerCase = str => str.toLowerCase(); const split = curry((splitOn, str) => str.split(splitOn)); ```
`toSlug` ``` // nesting-composition.js hosted with by GitHub const toSlug = input => encodeURIComponent( join('-')( map(toLowerCase)( split(' ')( input ) ) ) ); console.log(toSlug('JS Cheerleader')); // 'js-cheerleader' ```
`reduce` compose
``` // compose.js hosted with by GitHub const compose = (...fns) => x => fns.reduceRight((v, f) => f(v), x);const compose = (...fns) => x => fns.reduceRight((v, f) => f(v), x); ``` `.reduceRight()` `.reduce``.reduceRight`reducer`x``v`
compose toSlug
``` // using-compose.js hosted with by GitHub const toSlug = compose( encodeURIComponent, join('-'), map(toLowerCase), split(' ') ); console.log(toSlug('JS Cheerleader')); // 'js-cheerleader' ``` pipe Lodash`flow`
``` // pipe.js hosted with by GitHub const pipe = (...fns) => x => fns.reduce((v, f) => f(v), x); const fn1 = s => s.toLowerCase(); const fn2 = s => s.split('').reverse().join(''); const fn3 = s => s + '!' const newFunc = pipe(fn1, fn2, fn3); const result = newFunc('Time'); // emit! ``` `pipe``toSlug`
``` // using-pipe.js hosted with by GitHub const toSlug = pipe( split(' '), map(toLowerCase), join('-'), encodeURIComponent ); console.log(toSlug('JS Cheerleader')); // 'js-cheerleader' ``` `pipe`

``` // using-trace.js hosted with by GitHub const trace = curry((label, x) => { console.log(`== ${ label }: ${ x }`); return x; }); const toSlug = pipe( trace('input'), split(' '), map(toLowerCase), trace('after map'), join('-'), encodeURIComponent ); console.log(toSlug('JS Cheerleader')); // '== input: JS Cheerleader' // '== after map: js,cheerleader' // 'js-cheerleader' ``` `trace``tap`

Scott 

[
    {id: 110, title: "Rename everything", 
        dueDate: "2013-11-15", priority: "medium"},
    {id: 104, title: "Do something", 
        dueDate: "2013-11-29", priority: "high"}
]

  1. var getIncompleteTaskSummaries = function(membername) {
  return fetchData()
      .then(function(data) {
          return data.tasks;
      })
      .then(function(tasks) {
          return tasks.filter(function(task) {
              return task.username == membername
          })
      })
      .then(function(tasks) {
          return tasks.filter(function(task) {
              return !task.complete
          })
      })
      .then(function(tasks) {
          return tasks.map(function(task) {
              return {
                  id: task.id,
                  dueDate: task.dueDate,
                  title: task.title,
                  priority: task.priority
              }
          })
      })
      .then(function(tasks) {
          return tasks.sort(function(first, second) {
              var a = first.dueDate,
                  b = second.dueDate;
              return a < b ? -1 : a > b ? 1 : 0;
          });
      })
      .then(function(task) {
          console.log(task)
      })
};

getIncompleteTaskSummaries(Scott)


2.  Point-free <br/>

//
curry curry
var prop = curry(function(name, obj) {
return obj[name];
});

var propEq = curry(function(name, val, obj) {
return obj[name] === val;
});

var filter = curry(function(fn, arr) {
return arr.filter(fn)
});

var map = curry(function(fn, arr) {
return arr.map(fn)
});

var pick = curry(function(args, obj){
var result = {};
for (var i = 0; i < args.length; i++) {
result[args[i]] = obj[args[i]]
}
return result;
});

var sortBy = curry(function(fn, arr) {
return arr.sort(function(a, b){
var a = fn(a),
b = fn(b);
return a < b ? -1 : a > b ? 1 : 0;
})
});
//
var getIncompleteTaskSummaries = function(membername) {
return fetchData()
.then(prop(tasks))
.then(filter(propEq(username, membername)))
.then(filter(propEq(complete, false)))
.then(map(pick([id, dueDate, title, priority])))
.then(sortBy(prop(dueDate)))
};

getIncompleteTaskSummaries(Scott)

@underscore.js

var debounce = /** @class */ (function () {

  /**
   * @desc 
   * @param {*} func 
   * @param {*} wait 
   * @param {*} immediate  true false 
   */
  function debounce(func, wait, immediate) {

    // 
    var timeout,result;

    return function () {

      // this 
      var context = this;
      // event 
      var args = arguments;

      // 
      if (timeout) clearTimeout(timeout);

      if (immediate) {
        // 
        var callNow = !timeout;
        timeout = setTimeout(function(){
          timeout = null;
        }, wait)

        if (callNow) result = func.apply(context, args)
      }
      else {

        timeout = setTimeout(function(){
          func.apply(context, args)
        }, wait);
      }
      // func 
      return result;
    }
  }

  return debounce;

}())

  function throttle(func, wait) {
    var args;
    var previous = 0;

    return function() {
      var now = +new Date();
      args = arguments;
      if (now - previous > wait) {
        func.apply(this, args);
        previous = now;
      }
    }
  }

  return throttle
}())

function throttle(func, wait) {
  var timeout;
  var previous = 0;

  return function() {
    context = this;
    args = arguments;
    if (!timeout) {
      timeout = setTimeout(function(){

}

@underscore.js

var throttle = /** @class */ (function () {

  /**
   * throttle 
   * @param {*} func  
   * @param {*} wait  
   * @param {*} options  {leading: false}
   *                     {trailing: false}
   *                     
   */
  function throttle(func, wait, options) {

    var timeout, context, args;
    var previous = 0;
    if (!options) options = {};

    var later = function() {
      //  leading previous  0
      previous = options.leading === false ? 0 : new Date().getTime();
      // 
      timeout = null;
      func.apply(context, args);
      if (!timeout) context = args = null;
    };

    var throttled = function() {
      var now = new Date().getTime();

      if (!previous && options.leading === false) previous = now;
      // 
      var remaining = wait - (now - previous);
      context = this;
      args = arguments;
      if (remaining <= 0 || remaining > wait) {
        // 
        if (timeout) {
          clearTimeout(timeout);
          timeout = null;
        }
        previous = now;
        func.apply(context, args);
        if (!timeout) context = args = null;
      } else if (!timeout && options.trailing !== false) {
        //  trailing
        timeout = setTimeout(later, remaining);
      }
    };
    return throttled;
}

  return throttle
}())

ontainer.onmousemove = throttle(getContent, 1000);
container.onmousemove = throttle(getContent, 1000, {
  leading: false
});
container.onmousemove = throttle(getContent, 1000, {
  trailing: false
});

      if (!timeout) context = args = null;
    };

    var throttled = function() {
      var now = new Date().getTime();

      if (!previous && options.leading === false) previous = now;
      // 
      var remaining = wait - (now - previous);
      context = this;
      args = arguments;
      if (remaining <= 0 || remaining > wait) {
        // 
        if (timeout) {
          clearTimeout(timeout);
          timeout = null;
        }
        previous = now;
        func.apply(context, args);
        if (!timeout) context = args = null;
      } else if (!timeout && options.trailing !== false) {
        //  trailing
        timeout = setTimeout(later, remaining);
      }
    };
    return throttled;
}

  return throttle
}())

container.onmousemove = throttle(getContent, 1000, {
  leading: false
});
container.onmousemove = throttle(getContent, 1000, {
  trailing: false
});

  function _isFunction (func) {
    return Object.prototype.toString.call(func) === '[object Function]';
  }
  if (!_isFunction(fn)) {
    throw new Error('Promise must accept a function as a parameter')
  }

  var _this = this,
      _val = null;
      _this._resolves = [];
      _this._status = 'PENDING';

  this.then = function (onFulfilled) {
    return new Promise(function (resolve) {
      // handle  promise  then  promise  resolve 
      function handle(_val) {
        var ret = _isFunction(onFulfilled) && onFulfilled(_val) || _val
        //  promise  then 
        if (ret && _isFunction(ret['then'])) {
          ret.then(function (value) {
            resolve(value);
          })
        } else {

      if (_this._status === 'PENDING') {
       _this._resolves.push(handle);

  }

pending rejected reject()

function Promise(fn) {

  /**
   *  function
   * @param {*} func 
   */
  function _isFunction(func) {
    return Object.prototype.toString.call(func) === '[object Function]';
  }
  if (!_isFunction(fn)) {
    throw new Error('Promise must accept a function as a parameter')
  }


  var _this = this;
  _this._value;
  _this._reason;
  _this._resolves = [];
  _this._rejects = [];
  _this._status = "PENDING";

  /**
   * promise then
   * @onFulfilled 
   * @onRejected 
   */
  this.then = function (onFulfilled, onRejected) {
    return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {

      /**
       *  promise  then 
       *  promise  resolve 
       */
      function handle(value) {
        var ret = _isFunction(onFulfilled) && onFulfilled(value) || value
        if (ret && _isFunction(ret['then'])) {
          ret.then(
            function (value) {
              resolve(value);
            },
            function (reason) {
              reject(reason);
            }
          )
        } else {
          resolve(ret)
        }
      }

      /**
       * 
       */
      function errback(reason) {
        reason = _isFunction(onRejected) && onRejected(reason) || reason;
        reject(reason);
      }

      /**
       * 
       */
      var config = {
        'PENDING': function () {
          _this._resolves.push(handle);
          _this._rejects.push(errback);
        },
        'FULFILLED': function () {
          handle(value);
        },
        'REJECTED': function () {
          errback(_this._reason);
        }
      }

      config[_this._status]()
    })
  }

  /**
   * 
   * setTimeoutresolve 
   *  JS 
   * thenresolve
   * @FULFILLED 
   * @param {*} value 
   */
  function resolve(value) {
    setTimeout(function () {
      _this.status = "FULFILLED"
      _this._resolves.forEach(function (callback) {
       _this._value = callback(value)
      })
    }, 0)
  }

  /**
   * 
   * @REJECTED 
   * @param {*} value 
   */
  function reject(value) {
    setTimeout(function () {
      _this._status = "REJECTED"
      _this._rejects.forEach(function (callback) {
        _this._reason = callback(value);
      })
    }, 0)
  }

  fn(resolve, reject)
}


Promise.all

/**
 * Promise.all
 *  Promise 
 * Promise
 * promiseresolve
 */
Promise.all = function(promiseArr) {

  if (!Array.isArray(promiseArr)) {
    throw new TypeError('You must pass an array to all.');
  }
  //  promise 
  return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {
    let done = gen(promiseArr.length, resolve);
    promiseArr.forEach(function (promise, index) {
      promise.then(function (value) {
        done(index, value)
      },reject)
    })
  })
}

function gen(length, resolve) {
  let count = 0;
  let result = [];
  return function(i, value) {
    result[i] = value;
    if (++count === length) {
      resolve(result);
    }
  }
}


Promise.race

/**
 * Promise.race
 *  Promise 
 * Promise
 *  Promise ( resolve  reject)
 */

Promise.race = function(promiseArr) {

  if (!Array.isArray(promiseArr)) {
    throw new TypeError('You must pass an array to all.');
  }
  //  promise 
  return new Promise(function(resolve, reject){
    promiseArr.forEach(function (promise, index) {
      promise.then(resolve,reject)
    })
  })
}

/*
 * @Description: promise 
 * @Author: renbo
 * @Date: 2019-08-12 15:13:40
 * @LastEditTime: 2019-08-15 10:34:44
 */

var Promise = /** @class */ (function () {

  function Promise (fn) {

    var _this = this;
    _this._status = 'PENDING';
    _this._value = undefined;
    _this._reason = undefined;
    //
    _this._resolves = [];
    _this._rejects = [];

    // 
    if (!(typeof fn === 'function' )) {
      throw new TypeError('Promise must accept a function as a parameter');
    }
    if(!(this instanceof Promise)) return new Promise(fn);


   function resolve(value) {
      //apply
      _this.final.apply(_this,['FULFILLED'].concat([value]));
    }

    function reject(reason){
      _this.final.apply(_this,['REJECTED'].concat([reason]));
    }

    fn(resolve,reject);
  }

  /**
   * resolve  reject 
   * then
   * @param {*} status 
   * @param {*} value 
   */
  Promise.prototype.final = function (status,value) {
    var _this = this, fn, st;
    if(_this._status !== 'PENDING') return;

    setTimeout(function(){
      _this._status = status;
      st = _this._status === 'FULFILLED'
      queue = _this[st ? '_resolves' : '_rejects'];

      while(fn = queue.shift()) {
        value = fn.call(_this, value) || value;
      }

      _this[st ? '_value' : '_reason'] = value;
      _this['_resolves'] = _this['_rejects'] = undefined;
    });
  }

  /**
   * then 
   * @params onFulfilled
   * @params onRejected
   */
  Promise.prototype.then = function (onFulfilled,onRejected) {
    var _this = this;
    // promisethenable
    return new Promise(function(resolve,reject){

      function handle(value) {
        // resolve
        var ret = typeof onFulfilled === 'function' && onFulfilled(value) || value;

        //promise 
        if (ret && typeof ret ['then'] == 'function') {
            ret.then(function(value) {
                resolve(value);
            }, function(reason) {
                reject(reason);
            });
        } else {
          resolve(ret);
        }
      }

      function errback(reason){
        reason = typeof onRejected === 'function' && onRejected(reason) || reason;
        reject(reason);
      }

      // 
      var config = {
        'PENDING': function () {
          _this._resolves.push(handle);
          _this._rejects.push(errback);
        },
        'FULFILLED': function () {
          handle(value);
        },
        'REJECTED': function () {
          errback(_this._reason);
        }
      }

      config[_this._status]()
    });
  }


  /**
   * then
   */
  Promise.prototype.catch = function(onRejected){
    return this.then(undefined, onRejected)
  }


  /**
   * Promise.race
   *  Promise 
   * Promise
   *  Promise ( resolve  reject)
   */

  Promise.race = function(promiseArr) {

    if (!Array.isArray(promiseArr)) {
      throw new TypeError('You must pass an array to all.');
    }
    //  promise 
    return new Promise(function(resolve, reject){
      promiseArr.forEach(function (promise, index) {
        promise.then(resolve,reject)
      })
    })
  }


  /**
   * Promise.all
   *  Promise 
   * Promise
   * promiseresolve
   */
  Promise.all = function(promiseArr) {

    if (!Array.isArray(promiseArr)) {
      throw new TypeError('You must pass an array to all.');
    }
    //  promise 
    return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {
      let done = gen(promiseArr.length, resolve);
      promiseArr.forEach(function (promise, index) {
        promise.then(function (value) {
          done(index, value)
        },reject)
      })
    })

    //  promise  resolve
    function gen(length, resolve) {
      let count = 0;
      let result = [];
      return function(i, value) {
        result[i] = value;
        if (++count === length) {
          resolve(result);
        }
      }
    }
  }

  Promise.resolve = function(arg){
    return new Promise(function(resolve,reject){
        resolve(arg)
    })
  }

  Promise.reject = function(arg){
    return Promise(function(resolve,reject){
      reject(arg)
    })
  }

  return Promise;
}())

function Promise(fn) {

  /**
   *  function
   * @param {*} func 
   */
  function _isFunction(func) {
    return Object.prototype.toString.call(func) === '[object Function]';
  }
  if (!_isFunction(fn)) {
    throw new Error('Promise must accept a function as a parameter')
  }


  var _this = this;
  _this._value;
  _this._reason;
  _this._resolves = [];
  _this._rejects = [];
  _this._status = "PENDING";

  /**
   * promise then
   * @onFulfilled 
   * @onRejected 
   */
  this.then = function (onFulfilled, onRejected) {
    return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {

      /**
       *  promise  then 
       *  promise  resolve 
       */
      function handle(value) {
        var ret = _isFunction(onFulfilled) && onFulfilled(value) || value
        if (ret && _isFunction(ret['then'])) {
          ret.then(
            function (value) {
              resolve(value);
            },
            function (reason) {
              reject(reason);
            }
          )
        } else {
          resolve(ret)
        }
      }

      /**
       * 
       */
      function errback(reason) {
        reason = _isFunction(onRejected) && onRejected(reason) || reason;
        reject(reason);
      }

      /**
       * 
       */
      var config = {
        'PENDING': function () {
          _this._resolves.push(handle);
          _this._rejects.push(errback);
        },
        'FULFILLED': function () {
          handle(value);
        },
        'REJECTED': function () {
          errback(_this._reason);
        }
      }

      config[_this._status]()
    })
  }

  /**
   * 
   * setTimeoutresolve 
   *  JS 
   * thenresolve
   * @FULFILLED 
   * @param {*} value 
   */
  function resolve(value) {
    setTimeout(function () {
      _this.status = "FULFILLED"
      _this._resolves.forEach(function (callback) {
       _this._value = callback(value)
      })
    }, 0)
  }

  /**
   * 
   * @REJECTED 
   * @param {*} value 
   */
  function reject(value) {
    setTimeout(function () {
      _this._status = "REJECTED"
      _this._rejects.forEach(function (callback) {
        _this._reason = callback(value);
      })
    }, 0)
  }

  fn(resolve, reject)
}

function gen(length, resolve) {
  let count = 0;

    if (++count === length) {

var Promise = /** @class */ (function () {

  function Promise (fn) {

    var _this = this;
    _this._status = 'PENDING';
    _this._value = undefined;
    _this._reason = undefined;
    //
    _this._resolves = [];
    _this._rejects = [];

    // 
    if (!(typeof fn === 'function' )) {
      throw new TypeError('Promise must accept a function as a parameter');
    }
    if(!(this instanceof Promise)) return new Promise(fn);


   function resolve(value) {
      //apply
      _this.final.apply(_this,['FULFILLED'].concat([value]));
    }

    function reject(reason){
      _this.final.apply(_this,['REJECTED'].concat([reason]));
    }

    fn(resolve,reject);
  }

  /**
   * resolve  reject 
   * then
   * @param {*} status 
   * @param {*} value 
   */
  Promise.prototype.final = function (status,value) {
    var _this = this, fn, st;
    if(_this._status !== 'PENDING') return;

    setTimeout(function(){
      _this._status = status;
      st = _this._status === 'FULFILLED'
      queue = _this[st ? '_resolves' : '_rejects'];

      while(fn = queue.shift()) {
        value = fn.call(_this, value) || value;
      }

      _this[st ? '_value' : '_reason'] = value;
      _this['_resolves'] = _this['_rejects'] = undefined;
    });
  }

  /**
   * then 
   * @params onFulfilled
   * @params onRejected
   */
  Promise.prototype.then = function (onFulfilled,onRejected) {
    var _this = this;
    // promisethenable
    return new Promise(function(resolve,reject){

      function handle(value) {
        // resolve
        var ret = typeof onFulfilled === 'function' && onFulfilled(value) || value;

        //promise 
        if (ret && typeof ret ['then'] == 'function') {
            ret.then(function(value) {
                resolve(value);
            }, function(reason) {
                reject(reason);
            });
        } else {
          resolve(ret);
        }
      }

      function errback(reason){
        reason = typeof onRejected === 'function' && onRejected(reason) || reason;
        reject(reason);
      }

      // 
      var config = {
        'PENDING': function () {
          _this._resolves.push(handle);
          _this._rejects.push(errback);
        },
        'FULFILLED': function () {
          handle(value);
        },
        'REJECTED': function () {
          errback(_this._reason);
        }
      }

      config[_this._status]()
    });
  }


  /**
   * then
   */
  Promise.prototype.catch = function(onRejected){
    return this.then(undefined, onRejected)
  }


  /**
   * Promise.race
   *  Promise 
   * Promise
   *  Promise ( resolve  reject)
   */

  Promise.race = function(promiseArr) {

    if (!Array.isArray(promiseArr)) {
      throw new TypeError('You must pass an array to all.');
    }
    //  promise 
    return new Promise(function(resolve, reject){
      promiseArr.forEach(function (promise, index) {
        promise.then(resolve,reject)
      })
    })
  }


  /**
   * Promise.all
   *  Promise 
   * Promise
   * promiseresolve
   */
  Promise.all = function(promiseArr) {

    if (!Array.isArray(promiseArr)) {
      throw new TypeError('You must pass an array to all.');
    }
    //  promise 
    return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {
      let done = gen(promiseArr.length, resolve);
      promiseArr.forEach(function (promise, index) {
        promise.then(function (value) {
          done(index, value)
        },reject)
      })
    })

    //  promise  resolve
    function gen(length, resolve) {
      let count = 0;
      let result = [];
      return function(i, value) {
        result[i] = value;
        if (++count === length) {
          resolve(result);
        }
      }
    }
  }

  Promise.resolve = function(arg){
    return new Promise(function(resolve,reject){
        resolve(arg)
    })
  }

  Promise.reject = function(arg){
    return Promise(function(resolve,reject){
      reject(arg)
    })
  }

  return Promise;
}())

Post.title: crypto
Post.content:
crypto OpenSSL HMAC C/C++

MD5SHA1

MD5

// 
const crypto = require('crypto');

//  Hash 
const hash = crypto.createHash('md5');

// HMAC update() UTF-8Buffer
hash.update('Hello, nodejs!');

// encoding  'hex', 'latin1'  'base64'. 
  encoding  a Buffer.
console.log(hash.digest('hex'));

Hash  hash.digest()

Hmac

HmacMD5SHA1Hmac

// 
const crypto = require('crypto');

//  hmac 
const hmac = crypto.createHmac('sha256', 'secret-key');

// HMAC update() UTF-8Buffer
hmac.update('Hello, nodejs!');

// encoding  'hex', 'latin1'  'base64'. 
  encoding  a Buffer.
console.log(hmac.digest('hex'));

Hmac

AES

AEScryptoAES

// 
const crypto = require('crypto');
// 
function aesEncrypt(data, key) {
  const cipher = crypto.createCipher('aes192', key);
  let crypted = cipher.update(data, 'utf8', 'hex');
  crypted += cipher.final('hex');
  return crypted;
}
// 
function aesDecrypt(encrypted, key) {
  const decipher = crypto.createDecipher('aes192', key);
  let decrypted = decipher.update(encrypted, 'hex', 'utf8');
  decrypted += decipher.final('utf8');
  return decrypted;
}

let data = 'Hello, this is a secret message!';
let key = 'Password!';
let encrypted = aesEncrypt(data, key);
let decrypted = aesDecrypt(encrypted, key);

console.log('Plain text: ' + data);
console.log('Encrypted text: ' + encrypted);
console.log('Decrypted text: ' + decrypted);


Plain text: Hello, this is a secret message!
Encrypted text: 8a944d97bdabc157a5b7a40cb180e7...
Decrypted text: Hello, this is a secret message!

Diffie-Hellman

DHDH

// 
const crypto = require('crypto');

//  crypto_a
let crypto_a = crypto.createDiffieHellman(512);
let crypto_a_keys = crypto_a.generateKeys();


let prime = crypto_a.getPrime();
let generator = crypto_a.getGenerator();

console.log('Prime: ' + prime.toString('hex'));
console.log('Generator: ' + generator.toString('hex'));


//  crypto_b
let crypto_b = crypto.createDiffieHellman(prime, generator);
let crypto_b_keys = crypto_b.generateKeys();


// 
let a_secret = crypto_a.computeSecret(crypto_b_keys);
let b_secret = crypto_b.computeSecret(crypto_a_keys);

RSA

RSA

1RSA

openssl genrsa -aes256 -out rsa-key.pem 2048

AES

AEScryptoAES

// 
const crypto = require('crypto');
// 
function aesEncrypt(data, key) {
  const cipher = crypto.createCipher('aes192', key);
  let crypted = cipher.update(data, 'utf8', 'hex');
  crypted += cipher.final('hex');
  return crypted;
}
// 
function aesDecrypt(encrypted, key) {
  const decipher = crypto.createDecipher('aes192', key);
  let decrypted = decipher.update(encrypted, 'hex', 'utf8');
  decrypted += decipher.final('utf8');
  return decrypted;
}

let data = 'Hello, this is a secret message!';
let key = 'Password!';
let encrypted = aesEncrypt(data, key);
let decrypted = aesDecrypt(encrypted, key);

console.log('Plain text: ' + data);
console.log('Encrypted text: ' + encrypted);
console.log('Decrypted text: ' + decrypted);

JavaScript throw JavaScript Error

try/catch

  function fun () {
    throw new Error("error!");
  }
  try {
    fun();
  } catch (e) {
    console.log(e.message);

finally

catchfinallytry

try { 
  throw new Error("throw error"); 
} catch (e) { 
  console.log(e.message); 
} finally { 
  console.log(""); 
}

/**
 * 
 * master.js
 */

// child_process 
let cp = require('child_process');

// 
let child1 = cp.fork(__dirname + '/worker.js');
let child2 = cp.fork(__dirname + '/worker.js');

// 
let server = require('net').createServer();
server.listen(1337 ,function () {
  child1.send('server', server);
  child2.send('server', server);

  // 
  server.close();
});
/**
 * 
 * worker.js
 */

// http
let http = require('http');

// 
let server = http.createServer(function (req, res) {
  res.writeHead(200, {'Content-Type' : 'text/plain'});
  res.end('pid is' + process.pid)
});

// 
process.on('message', function (m, tcp) {
  if (m === 'server') {
    tcp.on('connection', function (socket) {
      server.emit('connection', socket);
    });
  }
}};

Post.raw:
--- title: querystring date: 2017-01-23 12:32:09 top: false cover: false password: toc: true mathjax: false summary: tags: - Node categories: - Node --- querystring URL
### URL querystring.parse(str[, sep[, eq[, options]]])
``` // const querystring = require('querystring'); querystring.parse('foo=bar&abc=xyz&abc=123') { foo: 'bar', abc: ['xyz', '123'] } ``` UTF-8 decodeURIComponent
``` // gbkEncodeURIComponent querystring.parse('w=%D6%D0%CE%C4&foo=bar', null, null,{ decodeURIComponent: gbkDecodeURIComponent }); ``` ### URL querystring.stringify(obj[, sep[, eq[, options]]])
``` // const querystring = require('querystring'); // 'foo=bar&baz=qux&baz=quux&corge=' querystring.stringify({ foo: 'bar', baz: ['qux', 'quux'], corge: '' }); // 'foo:bar;baz:qux' querystring.stringify({ foo: 'bar', baz: 'qux' }, ';', ':'); ``` UTF-8 encodeURIComponent ``` // gbkEncodeURIComponent querystring.stringify({ w: '', foo: 'bar' }, null, null,{ encodeURIComponent: gbkEncodeURIComponent }) ``` Node Api
Post.content:
querystring URL

URL querystring.parse(str[, sep[, eq[, options]]]) 

// 
const querystring = require('querystring');

querystring.parse('foo=bar&abc=xyz&abc=123')


{
  foo: 'bar',
  abc: ['xyz', '123']
}

UTF-8 decodeURIComponent 

//  gbkEncodeURIComponent 

querystring.parse('w=%D6%D0%CE%C4&foo=bar', null, null,{ decodeURIComponent: gbkDecodeURIComponent });

URL querystring.stringify(obj[, sep[, eq[, options]]]) 

// 
const querystring = require('querystring');

//  'foo=bar&baz=qux&baz=quux&corge='
querystring.stringify({ foo: 'bar', baz: ['qux', 'quux'], corge: '' });

//  'foo:bar;baz:qux'
querystring.stringify({ foo: 'bar', baz: 'qux' }, ';', ':');

UTF-8 encodeURIComponent 

//  gbkEncodeURIComponent 

querystring.stringify({ w: '', foo: 'bar' }, null, null,{ encodeURIComponent: gbkEncodeURIComponent })

``` const url = require('url'); ``` URL**url.hash**
``` const myURL = new URL('https://example.org/foo#bar'); console.log(myURL.hash); //#bar myURL.hash = 'baz'; console.log(myURL.href); //https://example.org/foo#baz ``` URL**url.host**
``` const myURL = new URL('https://example.org:81/foo'); console.log(myURL.host); //example.org:81 console.log(myURL.hostname) //example.org ``` url**url.href**
``` const myURL = new URL('https://example.org:81/foo'); console.log(myURL.href); //https://example.org:81/foo ``` URL**url.pathname**
``` const myURL = new URL('https://example.org:81/foo/abc?name=123'); console.log(myURL.pathname); // /foo/abc ``` URL**url.port 065535**
``` const myURL = new URL('https://example.org:81/foo/abc?name=123'); console.log(myURL.port); // 81 ``` URL**url.search**
``` const myURL = new URL('https://example.org:81/foo/abc?name=123'); console.log(myURL.search); // name=123 ``` URLSearchParamsURL**url.serchParams**
``` const myURL = new URL('https://example.org:81/foo/abc?name=123'); console.log(myURL.searchParams); // 123 ``` Node Api

  /**
   * People
   */
  abstract class People 
  {

    abstract protected function eat();
    abstract protected function sleep();
    abstract protected function study();
    public function runing() 
    {
      echo '</br>';
    }
  }

  /**
   * 
   */
  class Zhangsan extends People
  {
    protected function eat()
    {
      echo 'eat </br>';
      return 'eat';
    }

    protected function sleep()
    {
      echo 'sleep </br>';
      return 'sleep';
    }

    protected function study()
    {
      echo 'study </br>';
      return 'study';
    }

    public function getFunc () 
    {
      $this->eat();
      $this->sleep();
      $this->study();
    }
  }
  //

  $zhangsan->runing(); //
  $zhangsan->getFunc(); // eat sleep study

 public function eat ()
 {

 }
}

interface People  
{
  public function eat($color);
}

// Apple
class Apple implements People
{
 public function eat($color)
 {
    echo("$color <br/>");
 }
}

// Grape
class Grape implements People
{
  public function eat($color)
  {
    echo("$color ");
  }
}

$apple = new Apple();
$apple->eat(''); 

$grape = new Grape();
$grape->eat(''); 


  // People
  interface People  
  {  
    public function eat();  
  }

  // People
  interface Boy extends People  
  {  
    public function drink();  
  }

  // 
  class Behavior implements Boy  
  {  
    public function eat()  
    {  
        echo "<br>";  
    }  

    public function drink()  
    {  
      echo "<br>";  
    }  
  }         
  Behavior::eat();      
  Behavior::drink();

php

  class Connection 
  {
      protected $link;
      private $server, $username, $password, $db;

      public function __construct($server, $username, $password, $db)
      {
          $this->server = $server;
          $this->username = $username;
          $this->password = $password;
          $this->db = $db;
          $this->connect();
      }

      private function connect()
      {
          $this->link = mysql_connect($this->server, $this->username, $this->password);
          mysql_select_db($this->db, $this->link);
      }

      public function __sleep()
      {
          return array('server', 'username', 'password', 'db');
      }

      public function __wakeup()
      {
          $this->connect();
      }
  }

   }
   //

     console.log(`${this.name}  eat food`)
   }
 }

 people.name = 'zhangsan'; // setter: zhangsan

  1. ts public private protected
  • public ts public
  • private

public 

class People {
  public name;
  public constructor(name) {
    this.name = name;
  }
}

let people = new People('renbo');
console.log(people.name); // renbo

private 

class People {
  private  name;
  public constructor(name) {
    this.name = name;
  }
}

let people = new People('renbo');
console.log(people.name); // Property 'name' is private and only accessible within class 'People'.

// 
class People {
  private  name: string;
  public constructor(name: string) {
    this.name = name;
  }
}

class SmilePeople extends People {

  public constructor (name:string) {
    super(name)
    console.log(this.name); // Property 'name' is private and only accessible within class 'People'.
  }
}

protected 

class People {
  protected  name;
  public constructor(name) {
    this.name = name;
  }
}

let people = new People('renbo');
console.log(people.name); // Property 'name' is protected and only accessible within class 'People' and its subclasses.ts

    this.name = name;
  }
}

    console.log(this.name)
  }
}

let people  = new People ('zhangsna')

  1. abstract 
// 12
abstract class People {
  public name:string;
  public constructor (name:string) {
    this.name = name;
  }
  public abstract eat():string
}
// 
class SmilePeople extends People {
  static food: string = 'apple'
  // eat 
  public eat ():string {
    return `my name is ${this.name} I,m eating ${SmilePeople.food}`
  }
}

let smilePeople = new SmilePeople('zhangsan');
smilePeople.eat()

// 
abstract class People {
  public name:string;
  public constructor (name:string) {
    this.name = name;
  }
  public abstract eat ():void
}

let people = new People('zhangsan') // Cannot create an instance of an abstract class.

{

}

@Decorator @ 

@people
class People {
  constructor(){}

//

  // 
  return function(target){       
    console.log(target);
  }
}

// 
@people('zhangsan')
class People{
  constructor(){}
} 

function decorator1() {
  console.log("decorator1(): start");
  return function (target) {
    console.log("decorator1(): end");
  }
}

function decorator2() {
    console.log("decorator2(): start");
    return function (target) {
      console.log("decorator2(): end");
    }
}

class C {
  @decorator1()
  @decorator2()
  method() {}
}

( decorator1(decorator2()))

decorator1(): start
decorator2(): start
decorator2(): end
decorator1(): end

function personName<T extends {new(...args:any[]):{}}>(constructor:T){

 public name: string;
  constructor (name: string) {

    console.log(`Hi, my name is ${this.name}`) // Hi, my name is wangwu

}

class Point {
  @configurable
  static x = 1;
}

function configurable(target,x) {
  let descriptor = Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(target, x)
  Object.defineProperty(target, x, {
    ...descriptor,
    value: 2
  })
}
console.log(Point.x) // 2

{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "ES5",
    "experimentalDecorators": true,
    "emitDecoratorMetadata": true
  }
}

class Greeter {
    @format("Hello, %s")
    greeting: string;

    constructor(message: string) {
        this.greeting = message;
    }
    greet() {
        let formatString = getFormat(this, "greeting");
        return formatString.replace("%s", this.greeting);
    }
}

// reflect-metadata

Reflect.metadata Decorator

Reflect.getMetadata 

import "reflect-metadata";

const formatMetadataKey = Symbol("format");
function format(formatString: string) {
  return Reflect.metadata(formatMetadataKey, formatString);
}

function getFormat(target: any, propertyKey: string) {
  return Reflect.getMetadata(formatMetadataKey, target, propertyKey);
}

  return function (target : any , propertyKey : string ,parameterIndex : number) {
    obj[parameterIndex] = value
  }
}

class Hello{
  method(@require('lisi') name : string){
    console.log(name)
  }
}

console.log(obj) // ['lisi']

Post.title: Mixinx
Post.content:
JS ES5 prototype ES6 TS extends, mixinx 

// Disposable Mixin
class Disposable {
    isDisposed!: boolean;
    dispose() {
    console.log(this.isDisposed);
    }
}

// Activatable Mixin
class Activatable {
    isActive!: boolean;
    activate() {
       console.log(this.isActive)
    }
}

//  extends  implements
class SmartObject implements Disposable,Activatable {
    // Disposable
    isDisposed: boolean = false;
    dispose!: () => void;
    // Activatable
    isActive: boolean = false;
    activate!: () => void;
}

// mixins
applyMixins(SmartObject, [Disposable, Activatable]);


//  applyMixins mixins
function applyMixins(derivedCtor: any, baseCtors: any[]) {
    baseCtors.forEach(baseCtor => {
        Object.getOwnPropertyNames(baseCtor.prototype).forEach(name => {
            derivedCtor.prototype[name] = baseCtor.prototype[name];
        });
    });
}

let smartObject = new SmartObject()

smartObject.dispose() // false
smartObject.activate() // false

JS ES5 prototype ES6 TS extends, mixinx 

// Disposable Mixin
class Disposable {
    isDisposed!: boolean;
    dispose() {
    console.log(this.isDisposed);
    }
}

// Activatable Mixin
class Activatable {
    isActive!: boolean;
    activate() {
       console.log(this.isActive)
    }
}

//  extends  implements
class SmartObject implements Disposable,Activatable {
    // Disposable
    isDisposed: boolean = false;
    dispose!: () => void;
    // Activatable
    isActive: boolean = false;
    activate!: () => void;
}

// mixins
applyMixins(SmartObject, [Disposable, Activatable]);


//  applyMixins mixins
function applyMixins(derivedCtor: any, baseCtors: any[]) {
    baseCtors.forEach(baseCtor => {
        Object.getOwnPropertyNames(baseCtor.prototype).forEach(name => {
            derivedCtor.prototype[name] = baseCtor.prototype[name];
        });
    });
}

let smartObject = new SmartObject()

smartObject.dispose() // false
smartObject.activate() // false

  name: string;

  gender: 'm'
};

Cannot assign to 'id' because it is a read-only property.

interface Eat {
  eat ()
}

interface People extends Eat {
  eat()
  run ()
}



// 
interface Counter {
  (start: number): string;
  interval: number;
  reset(): void;
}
// 
function getCounter(): Counter {

  let counter = <Counter>function (start: number) { 
    console.log(start)
  };

  counter.interval = 0;

  counter.reset = function () {
    console.log('reset')
  };

  return counter;
}

let counter = getCounter()
counter(20); // 20
counter.reset(); // reset 
counter.interval = 5; // 5

// Type definitions for [~THE LIBRARY NAME~] [~OPTIONAL VERSION NUMBER~]
// Project: [~THE PROJECT NAME~]
// Definitions by: [~YOUR NAME~] <[~A URL FOR YOU~]>

/*~ If this library is callable (e.g. can be invoked as myLib(3)),
 *~ include those call signatures here.
 *~ Otherwise, delete this section.
 */
declare function myLib(a: string): string;
declare function myLib(a: number): number;

/*~ If you want the name of this library to be a valid type name,
 *~ you can do so here.
 *~
 *~ For example, this allows us to write 'var x: myLib';
 *~ Be sure this actually makes sense! If it doesn't, just
 *~ delete this declaration and add types inside the namespace below.
 */
interface myLib {
    name: string;
    length: number;
    extras?: string[];
}

/*~ If your library has properties exposed on a global variable,
 *~ place them here.
 *~ You should also place types (interfaces and type alias) here.
 */
declare namespace myLib {
    //~ We can write 'myLib.timeout = 50;'
    let timeout: number;

    //~ We can access 'myLib.version', but not change it
    const version: string;

    //~ There's some class we can create via 'let c = new myLib.Cat(42)'
    //~ Or reference e.g. 'function f(c: myLib.Cat) { ... }
    class Cat {
        constructor(n: number);

        //~ We can read 'c.age' from a 'Cat' instance
        readonly age: number;

        //~ We can invoke 'c.purr()' from a 'Cat' instance
        purr(): void;
    }

    //~ We can declare a variable as
    //~   'var s: myLib.CatSettings = { weight: 5, name: "Maru" };'
    interface CatSettings {
        weight: number;
        name: string;
        tailLength?: number;
    }

    //~ We can write 'const v: myLib.VetID = 42;'
    //~  or 'const v: myLib.VetID = "bob";'
    type VetID = string | number;

    //~ We can invoke 'myLib.checkCat(c)' or 'myLib.checkCat(c, v);'
    function checkCat(c: Cat, s?: VetID);
}

/*~ This is the module template file. You should rename it to index.d.ts
 *~ and place it in a folder with the same name as the module.
 *~ For example, if you were writing a file for "super-greeter", this
 *~ file should be 'super-greeter/index.d.ts'
 */

/*~ If this module is a UMD module that exposes a global variable 'myLib' when
 *~ loaded outside a module loader environment, declare that global here.
 *~ Otherwise, delete this declaration.
 */
export as namespace myLib;

/*~ If this module has methods, declare them as functions like so.
 */
export function myMethod(a: string): string;
export function myOtherMethod(a: number): number;

/*~ You can declare types that are available via importing the module */
export interface someType {
    name: string;
    length: number;
    extras?: string[];
}

/*~ You can declare properties of the module using const, let, or var */
export const myField: number;

/*~ If there are types, properties, or methods inside dotted names
 *~ of the module, declare them inside a 'namespace'.
 */
export namespace subProp {
    /*~ For example, given this definition, someone could write:
     *~   import { subProp } from 'yourModule';
     *~   subProp.foo();
     *~ or
     *~   import * as yourMod from 'yourModule';
     *~   yourMod.subProp.foo();
     */
    export function foo(): void;
}

JS module TS TS namespacesmodules


  • JavaScript
  • namespace
  • outFile
  • require

1.

  namespace Validation {
    export interface StringValidator {
      isAcceptable(s: string): boolean;
    }

    const lettersRegexp = /^[A-Za-z]+$/;
    const numberRegexp = /^[0-9]+$/;

    export class LettersOnlyValidator implements StringValidator {
        isAcceptable(s: string) {
            return lettersRegexp.test(s);
        }
    }

    export class ZipCodeValidator implements StringValidator {
        isAcceptable(s: string) {
            return s.length === 5 && numberRegexp.test(s);
        }
    }
  }

2.

Validation.ts

namespace Validation {
  export interface StringValidator {
    isAcceptable(s: string): boolean;
  }
}

LettersOnlyValidator.ts

/// <reference path="Validation.ts" />
namespace Validation {
    const lettersRegexp = /^[A-Za-z]+$/;
    export class LettersOnlyValidator implements StringValidator {
        isAcceptable(s: string) {
            return lettersRegexp.test(s);
        }
    }
}

ZipCodeValidator.ts

/// <reference path="Validation.ts" />
namespace Validation {
    const numberRegexp = /^[0-9]+$/;
    export class ZipCodeValidator implements StringValidator {
        isAcceptable(s: string) {
            return s.length === 5 && numberRegexp.test(s);
        }
    }
}

Test.ts

/// <reference path="Validation.ts" />
/// <reference path="LettersOnlyValidator.ts" />
/// <reference path="ZipCodeValidator.ts" />

// Some samples to try
let strings = ["Hello", "98052", "101"];

// Validators to use
let validators: { [s: string]: Validation.StringValidator; } = {};
validators["ZIP code"] = new Validation.ZipCodeValidator();
validators["Letters only"] = new Validation.LettersOnlyValidator();

// Show whether each string passed each validator
for (let s of strings) {
  for (let name in validators) {
    console.log(`"${ s }" - ${ validators[name].isAcceptable(s) ? "matches" : "does not match" } ${ name }`);
  }
}

  1. outFile 
    tsc --outFile sample.js Test.ts
  2. JS Script 
    <script src="Validation.js" type="text/javascript" />
<script src="LettersOnlyValidator.js" type="text/javascript" />
<script src="ZipCodeValidator.js" type="text/javascript" />
<script src="Test.js" type="text/javascript" />

class ZipCodeValidator implements StringValidator {
  isAcceptable(s: string) {
    return s.length === 5 && numberRegexp.test(s);
  }
}

export { ZipCodeValidator as mainValidator };

export * from "./StringValidator";

export * from "./ZipCodeValidator";

2. import

let myValidator = new ZipCodeValidator();

import { ZipCodeValidator as ZCV } from "./ZipCodeValidator";
let myValidator = new ZCV();

import * as validator from "./ZipCodeValidator";

let myValidator = new validator.ZipCodeValidator();

import "./my-module.js";
